intro: Cyclanthera trigonoloba, commonly known as the three-angled bitter apple, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, squash, and gourds. The plant produces small, bitter fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a distinctive three-lobed appearance. Cyclanthera trigonoloba is characterized by its hairy stems and yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters.
